question: I'm thinking about starting a cloud factory. I just need some water vapor and clean air.
Sounds airy-fairy to me, but make sure you're not violating the Clean Air Act!
Why don't cars play hide and seek?
Because they always get spotted in the emissions test!
My pet rock just passed the emissions test.
Well, that's a 'solid' step towards adhering to the Clean Air Act!
Why was the ocean always getting into trouble?
Because it couldn't keep its shores clean!
Did you hear about the brook that filed a complaint?
It was tired of being taken for granite and wanted to ensure its rights under the Clean Water Act!
Why don't lakes make good secret keepers?
Because you can see right through them!
I'm starting a dating app for endangered species, call it 'Tinder for Tigers.'
Hmm, are you sure that's in line with the Endangered Species Act?
Why was the dodo bird super popular at the party?
Because it was the life of the 'endangered' party!
If an endangered animal doesn't practice social distancing, does it get fined?
Well, I don't think the Endangered Species Act covers pandemic etiquette!
What's a tree's favorite legal document?
I bet it's the National Environmental Policy Act!
Why don't environmental policies go to the gym?
Because they always get too much 'NEPA' (nap) time!
Do you think the National Environmental Policy Act covers my little brother's room? It's a disaster zone.
I think you'll need a different act for that one, maybe the 'Room Cleanup Act'?
Why did the coffee cup file a report?
Because it felt 'crushed' and wanted protection under the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act!
options: Resource Conservation and Recovery Act (RCRA) (correct answer)

question: Why was the soda can practicing its signature?
Because it wanted to be 'recognized' under the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act!
options: Resource Conservation and Recovery Act (RCRA) (correct answer)

question: My pet rock wants to be a part of the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act. What do you think?
I think it's already the epitome of 'rock solid' conservation!
options: Resource Conservation and Recovery Act (RCRA) (correct answer)

question: Why was the oil spill packing its bags?
Because it heard that CERCLA was coming to town!
options: Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act (CERCLA) (correct answer)

question: Do you think if I accidentally spill my milkshake, CERCLA would come to clean it up?
Only if your milkshake is classified as a hazardous substance!
options: Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act (CERCLA) (correct answer)

question: My soda just exploded. Do I need to call in a CERCLA clean-up crew?
Well, as dramatic as that sounds, I don't think your soda qualifies as a 'Superfund' site!
options: Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act (CERCLA) (correct answer)

question: If I change the color of my room, would I need an Environmental Impact Assessment?
Depends, how 'shocking' is the color?
Why was the construction project always the last one picked for the dodgeball team?
Because it always has to pass an EIA before it can make an impact!
I heard the Environmental Impact Assessment is the life of the party. Why is that?
Well, it always knows how to make an 'impact'!
I heard bees got a new job!
Yeah, they're buzzing about their role in providing ecosystem services.
Why do trees make the best bankers?
Because they're great at providing 'green' services!
Did you hear about the river that won an award?
Yes, it got 'current' recognition for its water purification services!
Why did the smog break up with the city?
Because the city said, 'It's not me, it's you,' and started focusing on pollution prevention.
Why did the piece of trash go to therapy?
It wanted to stop being part of the problem and start being part of the pollution prevention!
Why did the car stop farting?
Because it switched to electric – doing its part for pollution prevention!
Why did the wind turbine refuse to go on a date with the coal mine?
Because it only has eyes for sustainable development!
Why did the solar panel get a standing ovation at the energy convention?
It's always the 'light' of the party when it comes to sustainable development!
Did you hear about the tree that got a promotion?
I guess it's 'branching out' into sustainable development!
Why was the panda bear good at networking?
Because it understood the importance of having a diverse set of connections!
Why did the coral reef refuse to play chess?
Because it felt like the game wasn't diverse enough for its taste.
Did you hear about the forest that won the beauty pageant?
No doubt, with that much biodiversity, it must have been a stunning sight!
Why did the CO2 molecule apologize at the international conference?
Because it realized it had been a 'greenhouse gas-lighting' the entire planet!
Why did the polar bear send a thank you card to the climate change policy?
Because it appreciated the effort to save its icy home!
What did the glacier say to the Climate Change Policy?
Icy what you did there, and it's cool!
